page.title: 18PONDHEAD POULTRY FARM HOLT
page.content: Mr Battens' farm is mostly poultry. He also has a number of cattle and also market garden. He has sixteen thousand birds from which he gets ten thousand eggs. He then sorts the eggs into seven different grades on special weighing machines. The eggs are then put onto trays and travel under a light where they are checked for cracks. They are then weighed again but only the right size eggs are passed through. After that the eggs go to the local town shops but not the supermarkets. The battery hens spread diseases and no-one is allowed to see them. The young chicks are vaccinated against most things but they can still spread diseases. The temperature in the brooder machine has to be 90f.
